conclusion: To find the magnitude of the Ampere force, consider forces on each wire segment due to the magnetic field.
The wire is bent into a V-shape with two equal segments, each of length l, and the angle between the segments is 60°.
The magnetic field B is perpendicular to the plane of the wire.
The force on a current-carrying wire in a magnetic field is given by F = I L × B.
The force on each segment will be perpendicular to both the current direction and the magnetic field.
Resolve the force on each segment into components parallel and perpendicular to the line joining the two ends of the V-shape.
The perpendicular component of the force on each segment is F_perp = I l B sin(60°).
Since sin(60°) = √3/2, F_perp = I l B √3/2.
The total perpendicular force is F_total = 2 × I l B √3/2 = I l B √3.
The magnitude of the Ampere force received by the V-shaped wire is I l B √3.
